subject: Science
title: Your Sense of Balance
description: A short lesson to help you apply Your Sense of Balance.

hook.text: You can stand on one foot with your eyes closed because of fluid in your inner ear.

buildup.text: The vestibular system uses three semicircular canals filled with fluid.

discovery.text: When you move, the fluid shifts and bends tiny hairs â€” telling the brain your head's position.

twist.text: Motion sickness happens when your eyes and inner ear send conflicting signals to the brain.

climax.text: Astronauts often vomit in space because their vestibular system can't handle zero gravity.

punchline.text: Balance is fluid sloshing in your ear. In space, the fluid floats â€” and so do you.

quiz.question: What causes motion sickness?
options: Conflicting signals between eyes and inner ear
Too much fluid in the ear canals
